subject: Business
title: Currency Risk in Global Supply Chains
description: A micro-lesson that makes Currency Risk in Global Supply Chains usable.

hook.text: You agree to buy parts for 100 yen each. By delivery, the yen strengthens 15%. Your costs jump $150,000.

buildup.text: Currency risk means exchange rate fluctuations can change the actual cost of international transactions.

discovery.text: A 10% currency shift can erase an entire year's profit margin on an international deal.

twist.text: Companies use hedging â€” financial contracts that lock in exchange rates â€” to protect against swings.

climax.text: Airbus prices planes in dollars but incurs costs in euros. Currency management is as important as engineering.

punchline.text: In global trade, the exchange rate is the invisible price tag on everything.

quiz.question: How do companies protect against currency risk?
options: By hedging with financial contracts that lock in exchange rates
By only trading in their home currency
By storing large amounts of foreign cash
